attributes.action: Change the 20-hours restriction ban on international students to 30-hours
attributes.additional_details: This limitation forces many students to seek alternative, often informal, employment to meet their financial needs. To alleviate these difficulties, the government should consider lifting the 20-hour work restriction or adjusting it to reflect current economic conditions. Such a measure would provide international students with greater flexibility to support themselves and contribute to the UK economy.
attributes.background: In recent years, international students have encountered hurdles, including a competitive job market and stringent visa regulations. Despite the rising cost of living and inflationary pressures, the 20-hour work restriction during term-time remains unchanged.
